page.title: 09Entertainment:World's End
page.content: There is not much chance of entertainment in this area as it is essentially a rural area where farming prevails. From the World's End area it is about 5 miles to Newbury,and 15-20 miles to Reading. These are the nearest places of entertainment. There is a "Friendship Circle" which takes old people to places of interest. The church in Hampstead Norreys is quite well known and is well supported by fetes. There used to be Guides and Scouts in the area but there are now only Cubs. There are two pubs in the area. They are both on the old A34 and have an area for children. However for proper entertainment one must journey outside the area.
